title: Inline assembly does not work as expected in x86_64 windows target with release mode
body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

I tried this code:

```rust
use std::arch::asm;

pub fn compare_strings(s1: &str, s2: &str) -> bool {
    let s1_bytes = s1.as_bytes();
    let s2_bytes = s2.as_bytes();

    if s1_bytes.len() != s2_bytes.len() {
        return false;
    }

    if s1_bytes.is_empty() {
        return true;
    }

    let mut result: u8;
    unsafe {
        asm!(
            "repe cmpsb",
            "sete al",
            in("cx") s1_bytes.len(),
            in("si") s1_bytes.as_ptr(),
            in("di") s2_bytes.as_ptr(),
            out("al") result,
        );
    }

    result != 0
}

fn main() {
    let s1 = "Hello";
    let s2 = "Hello";
    let s3 = "World";
    let s4 = "Hella";

    println!("{}", compare_strings(s1, s2)); // true
    println!("{}", compare_strings(s1, s3)); // false
    println!("{}", compare_strings(s1, s4)); // false
}
```

I expected to see this happen:
```
true
false
false
```

Instead, this happened:
```
true
true
true
```

### Meta
<!--
If you're using the stable version of the compiler, you should also check if the
bug also exists in the beta or nightly versions.
-->

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.66.0 (69f9c33d7 2022-12-12)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 69f9c33d71c871fc16ac445211281c6e7a340943
commit-date: 2022-12-12
host: x86_64-pc-windows-msvc
release: 1.66.0
LLVM version: 15.0.2
```
